fields.value: Setup and settings such as %connect_command_mention% or %disable_command_mention%.

**All commands in a category** can be viewed with: **%help_command_mention% <category>**.
**Still need help?** => [Support Discord Server](%invite_link%)

**More info about a command** can be viewed with: **%help_command_mention% <command>**.
**Still need help?** => [Support Discord Server](%invite_link%)

options.label: Chat Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a player chats.

options.label: Join Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a player joins the server.

options.label: Quit Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a player leaves the server.

options.label: Advancement Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a player completes an advancement.

options.label: Death Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a player dies.

options.label: Player Command Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a command is sent by a player.

options.label: Console Command Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a command is sent by the console.

options.label: Block Command Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever a command block is executed.

options.label: Startup Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever the server starts up.

options.label: Shutdown Messages
options.description: Send a message whenever the server shuts down.

options.name: command
options.description: Set the command or category of which you want to get infos.

advancements.name: advancements
advancements.long_description: Look up your and other member's unlocked/completed recipes/advancements. You can find a list of all advancement (ids) [here](https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Advancement#List_of_advancements).
advancements.description: Look up your and other member's minecraft advancements.

options.name: advancement
options.description: Set the advancement

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the advancement from.

inventory.name: inventory
inventory.long_description: Get an image of the current player's inventory.
inventory.description: Get an image of the current player's inventory.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the inventory from.

options.name: show_details
options.description: Set whether to display buttons that show more details about items.

stats.name: stats
stats.long_description:
Look at your and other member's minecraft server stats.
All Categories (ids) can be found [here](https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Statistics#Statistic_types_and_names)!
All stats of the `custom` category can be found [here](https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Statistics#Statistic_types_and_names).
stats.description: Look at your and other member's minecraft server stats.
stats.example:
/stats mined iron_ore @Lianecx
/stats custom play_time BastiGHG
/stats killed blaze ILoveCheese

options.name: custom
options.description: A multitude of generic statistics related to a player's actions.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set a custom stat. All stats of the custom category => /help stats

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: mined
options.description: Statistic related to the number of blocks a player mined.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set a block (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: broken
options.description: Statistics related to the number of items a player ran their durability negative.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set an item (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: crafted
options.description: Statistics related to the number of items crafted, smelted, etc.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set an item (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: used
options.description: Statistics related to the number of block or item used.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set an item or block (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: picked_up
options.description: Statistics related to the number of dropped items a player picked up.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set an item (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: dropped
options.description: Statistics related to the number of items that dropped.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set an item (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: killed
options.description: Statistics related to the number of entities a player killed.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set an entity (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

options.name: killed_by
options.description: Statistics related to the times of a player being killed by entities.

options.name: stat
options.description: Set an entity (id)

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to get the stats from.

ban.name: ban
ban.long_description: Ban a player from the **minecraft server**. Can only be used with `Ban member` permission!
ban.description: Ban a player from the minecraft server.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to ban.

options.name: reason
options.description: Set a reason for the ban.

command.name: command
command.long_description: Execute any command on the **minecraft-server**. Can only be executed by admins.
command.description: Execute any command on the minecraft-server.
command.example:
/command gamemode creative Lianecx
/command give Lianecx Golden Apple
/command tp @a 0 0 0

options.name: command
options.description: Set the command name.

options.name: argument1
options.description: Set the first command argument.

options.name: argument2
options.description: Set the second command argument.

options.name: argument3
options.description: Set the third command argument.

options.name: argument4
options.description: Set the fourth command argument.

options.name: argument5
options.description: Set the fifth command argument.

options.name: argument6
options.description: Set the sixth command argument.

options.name: argument7
options.description: Set the seventh command argument.

options.name: argument8
options.description: Set the eighth command argument.

options.name: argument9
options.description: Set the ninth command argument.

deop.name: deop
deop.long_description: Deop players on the **minecraft-server**. Can only be used by admins.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to deop.

gamemode.name: gamemode
gamemode.long_description: Change the gamemode of a player on the **minecraft server**. Can only be used by admins.
gamemode.description: Change the gamemode of a player on the minecraft-server.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to change the gamemode of.

options.name: gamemode
options.description: Set the gamemode.

kick.name: kick
kick.long_description: Kick a player from the **minecraft server**. Can only be used with `Kick member` permission!
kick.description: Kick a player from the minecraft server.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to kick.

options.name: reason
options.description: Set a reason for the kick.

op.name: op
op.long_description: OP players on the **minecraft-server**. Can only be used by admins.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to OP.

unban.name: unban
unban.long_description: Unban a banned player from the **minecraft-server**. Can only be used with `Ban member` permissions.
unban.description: Unban a banned player from the minecraft-server.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to unban.

message.name: message
message.long_description: Send private chat messages to members on the server. Color codes can be found [here](https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Formatting_codes#Color_codes).
message.description: Send private chat messages to members on the server.

options.name: user
options.description: Set the user you want to send a (private) message to.

options.name: message
options.description: Set the (private) message you want to send to the user.

chatchannel.name: chatchannel
chatchannel.long_description: Add or remove a channel in which the bot will send minecraft chat messages and logs.
chatchannel.description: Add or remove a channel in which the bot will send minecraft chat messages and logs.

options.name: add
options.description: Set a chatchannel.

options.name: channel
options.description: Set the channel.

options.name: webhooks
options.description: Enable webhook mode for chat messages.

options.name: remove
options.description: Remove an existing chatchannel.

options.name: channel
options.description: Set the channel.

options.name: list
options.description: List all chatchannels.

connect.name: connect
connect.long_description:
Connect your minecraft java-edition server or account with your bot. Connection methods are:
-ftp (also includes sftp/ftps)
-plugin
-account
**You can download the plugin using [this link](https://www.spigotmc.org/resources/discord-linker.98749/).**
connect.description: Connect your minecraft server or account with the bot.
connect.example:
/connect account Lianecx
/connect plugin serverIp
/connect ftp host username password

options.name: ftp
options.description: Connect your Minecraft server using ftp/sftp/ftps.

options.name: host
options.description: Set the ftp-host.

options.name: username
options.description: Set the ftp-username. (`none` if no username)

options.name: password
options.description: Set the ftp-password (`none` if no password).

options.name: port
options.description: Set the ftp-port.

options.name: version
options.description: Set the Minecraft version.

options.name: path
options.description: Set the server-path (Format: /path/to/server).

options.name: plugin
options.description: Connect your Minecraft server using the Discord-Linker plugin.

options.name: ip
options.description: Set the server-ip.

options.name: port
options.description: Set the port of the plugin from the config.yml

options.name: account
options.description: Connect your Minecraft server using ftp/sftp/ftps.

options.name: username
options.description: Set your Minecraft java-edition username.

disable.name: disable
disable.long_description:
Disable a specific command/stat/advancement. List of disabled commands/stats/advancements with `/disable list`.
 Command-disabling is also possible through buttons in /help <command>.
disable.example:
/disable commands txp
/disable stats picked_up
/disable advancements adventuring_time
/disable list commands

options.name: commands
options.description: Disable a command

options.name: command
options.description: Set the command you want to disable

options.name: advancements
options.description: Disable an advancement

options.name: advancement
options.description: Set the advancement you want to disable

options.name: stats
options.description: Disable a stat

options.name: stat
options.description: Set the stat you want to disable

options.name: list
options.description: Get a list of all disabled stats/advancements/commands

options.name: category
options.description: Set the category which you want to list

disconnect.name: disconnect
disconnect.long_description: Disconnect your minecraft java-edition server or minecraft java-edition account from the bot and delete all saved credentials. To connect again, use `/connect`.
disconnect.description: Disconnect your minecraft server or minecraft account from the bot.

options.name: ftp
options.description: Disconnect from the minecraft-plugin.

options.name: plugin
options.description: Disconnect from the minecraft-plugin.

options.name: account
options.description: Disconnect your minecraft-account.

enable.name: enable
enable.long_description: Enable a disabled command/stat/advancement (They're all enabled by default). Command-enabling is also possible through buttons in `/help <command>`.
enable.description: Enable a disabled command/stat/advancement (All enabled by default)
enable.example:
/enable commands txp
/enable stats picked_up
/enable advancements adventuring_time

options.name: commands
options.description: Enable a disabled command

options.name: command
options.description: Set the command you want to enable

options.name: stats
options.description: Enable a disabled stat

options.name: stat
options.description: Set the stat you want to enable

options.name: advancements
options.description: Enable a disabled advancement

options.name: advancement
options.description: Set the advancement you want to enable
